citations.narrative:
There was a young zebra and a young alpaca housed in a cattle alley the day of the auction sale on October 21, 2023.
The cattle alley was only 29 inches wide and was not large enough to allow the zebra or alpaca to turn about freely or to
make normal postural and social adjustments. Animals housed in primary enclosures with inadequate space can cause
stress and increase the risk of injury. Licensee must ensure that animals housed in primary enclosures for the auction
have sufficient space to allow animals to make normal postural and social adjustments. Correct by October 26, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the president.
Additional Inspectors:
AMY NOOYEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.128 
   
Space requirements. 
There was a young zebra and a young alpaca housed in a cattle alley the day of the auction sale on October 21, 2023. 
The cattle alley was only 29 inches wide and was not large enough to allow the zebra or alpaca to turn about freely or to 
make normal postural and social adjustments. Animals housed in primary enclosures with inadequate space can cause 
stress and increase the risk of injury. Licensee must ensure that animals housed in primary enclosures for the auction 
have sufficient space to allow animals to make normal postural and social adjustments. Correct by October 26, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the president. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
AMY NOOYEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
